case_title: Province of Punjab through Conservator of Forest, Faisalabad, etc vs Javed Iqbal
appellant: Province of Punjab through Conservator of Forest, Faisalabad, etc

accussed_details.name: Javed Iqbal
allegation: Fraud causing losses to the government

complaint_summary: The respondent was accused of negligence and fraud causing losses to the government during his tenure as a Forest Guard.
investigation_summary: Departmental proceedings were initiated against the respondent on 19.12.2009, continued after his retirement on 15.04.2010, and finalized on 23.10.2012, exceeding the statutory limit of two years post-retirement.
judgment_summary: The court ruled that proceedings finalized beyond the statutory limit of two years post-retirement are void under Section 21 of the Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006. The petitions were dismissed, and the court emphasized the importance of timely resolution of cases involving retired employees.
legal_arguments: Proviso to Section 21 of the Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006 is mandatory.
Proceedings finalized beyond two years post-retirement are void.
Legislative intent prioritizes timely resolution to avoid unnecessary government expense and ensure retired employees enjoy peace.
statutes: Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006
sections: Section 21 of Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006
Section 1(4)(iii) of Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006
key_issues: Whether the proviso to Section 21 of the Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006 is mandatory or directory.
Validity of departmental proceedings finalized beyond two years post-retirement.

maxims.Interpretation of Statutes: A provision is mandatory if non-compliance renders proceedings void; directory if observance is not necessary for validity.

legal_terms.Mandatory Provision: A legal requirement that must be strictly followed.
legal_terms.Directory Provision: A guideline that does not invalidate proceedings if not followed.

words_and_phrases.Proviso: A clause in a statute that qualifies the preceding section.
words_and_phrases.Superannuation: Retirement due to reaching the age limit.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the interpretation of Section 21 of the Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006, focusing on whether the proviso is mandatory or directory. The court ruled that proceedings finalized beyond two years post-retirement are void, emphasizing legislative intent to ensure timely resolution and avoid unnecessary government expense.

reasoning: Legislative intent prioritizes efficiency and accountability within strict timelines.
Proviso uses mandatory language ('shall') and negative phrasing ('not later than').
Proceedings finalized after two years of retirement are void.
precedents: Muhammad Zaheer Khan vs. Government of Pakistan, 2010 SCMR 1554
Muhammad Anwar Bajwa vs. Chairman, Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan, 2001 PLC (CS) 336
Province of the Punjab v. Munir Hussain Shah, 1998 SCMR 1326

future_guidance.recommendation: Government must fast-track cases of retired employees to conclude within statutory timelines.
future_guidance.policy_rationale: Avoid unnecessary expense and ensure retired employees enjoy peaceful retirement.
